intro: Ouratea phaeophylla, commonly known as the dark-leaf ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. The species is often found in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates.
